clinical_study.brief_title: Shock Wave Therapy for Sural Myofascial Pain Associated to Chronic Heel Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Shock Wave Therapy for Sural Myofascial Pain Syndrome Associated With Plantar Fasciitis: a Pilot Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this randomized controlled study in to investigate if a shock wave treatment extended to the gastrocnemius-soleus trigger points (TrP) is more effective than a standard treatment exclusively targeted at the plantar fascia in a population affected by unilateral plantar fasciitis with concomitant sural myofascial pain syndrome.

primary_outcome.time_frame: FFI was administered at baseline, at two months time point and at three months time point
primary_outcome.description: Foot Function Index is self-administered questionnaire designed to measure foot performances in relation to symptoms. Foot Function Index is structured in two sections of nine items each, investigating foot pain (FFI-A) and function (FFI-B) respectively. The total score of each section ranges from zero (no pain/no functional limitation) to 100 (intolerable pain/complete inability). The two scores were separately analysed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: PPT was recorded at baseline, at two months time point and at three months time point
secondary_outcome.description: Pressure pain threshold (PPT) of the gastrocnemius-soleus trigger points was assessed by means of a digital hand-held algometer (see procedures for details). PPT is the minimal force that induces pain and its measurement is useful to quantitatively evaluate the effect of a treatment on trigger points

arm_group.arm_group_label: Experimental group:shock waves extended to gastrocnemius TrP
arm_group.description: Focused shock wave therapy was extended from the plantar fascia to the gastrocnemius-soleus trigger points.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Control group: shock waves not extended to gastrocnemius TrP
arm_group.description: A standard focused shock wave therapy exclusively targeted at the plantar fascia

intervention.intervention_name: Shock wave therapy on plantar fascia extended to the gastrocnemius-soleus trigger points
intervention.description: Enrolled subjects were treated with focused shock wave therapy, once a week for three consecutive weeks, by a specialized physician with more than five years of expertise, using a device powered by a piezoelectric generator (PIEZOSON 100PLUS, Richard Wolf®). At each treatment session, with the patients lying in prone decubitus position, the enthesis of the plantar fascia and the gastrocnemius-soleus trigger points were clinically targeted and treated with a perpendicular technique.
intervention.arm_group_label: Experimental group:shock waves extended to gastrocnemius TrP

intervention.intervention_name: Shock wave therapy on plantar fascia only
intervention.description: Enrolled subjects were treated with focused shock wave therapy, once a week for three consecutive weeks, by a specialized physician with more than five years of expertise, using a device powered by a piezoelectric generator (PIEZOSON 100PLUS, Richard Wolf®). At each treatment session, with the patients lying in prone decubitus position, the enthesis of the plantar fascia was clinically targeted and treated with a perpendicular technique.
